Dev Guide¶

Description of Stargate classes/modules/functions.

The Manager Class¶

class stargate.manager.Manager(app, db, decorators=None, url_prefix=None)¶

This class let you expose JSON RESTFul APIs against various resources.

Parameters:
  • app – should be Flask instance. If you wish to use flask test client for testing you can also provide FlaskClient instance.
  • db – should be SQLAlchemy instance.
  • decorators – should be python decorators. Each resource registered with a manager instance will invoke all specified decorators before view functions are invoked.
  • url_prefix – prefix url for all endpoints registered with Manager instance. url_prefix should start with ‘/’.

Example usage of this class. Models should be defined using flask_sqlalchemy:

from stargate import Manager
from models import User

manager = Manager(app, db)
#With decorators
manager = Manager(app, db, decorators = [auth_decorator])
#With url_prefix
manager = Manager(app, db, url_prefix = '/v1')
register_resource(*args, **kwargs)¶

This method perform sanity check of argument passed, create resource blueprint blueprint, register it with Flask and finally add this blueprint to registered blueprints

Example usage of this method:

from stargate import Manager
from models import User

manager = Manager(app, db)
manager.register_resource(User)

This method supports sereral options:

from stargate import Manager
from models import User

manager = Manager(app, db)

#Specify resource methods
manager.register_resource(User, methods = ['GET', 'POST'])

#Specify url_prefix
manager.register_resource(User, url_prefix = '/v2')

#Specify endpoint
manager.register_resource(User, endpoint = '/onlineusers')

#Specify resource fields
manager.register_resource(User, fields = ['username', 'email', 'date_added'])

#Exclude resource attributes
manager.register_resource(User, exclude = ['password'])

#Specify resource decorators
manager.register_resource(User, decorators = [check_user_quota])

#Specify resource primary key
manager.register_resource(User, primary_key = 'ser_id')
create_resource_blueprint(name, model, methods=frozenset({'GET'}), url_prefix=None, endpoint=None, fields=None, exclude=None, decorators=[], primary_key=None)¶

This method returns blueprint of a resource with specified options.

Parameters:
  • name – blueprint name
  • model – user defined model class Using Model
  • methods – HTTP methods allowed on resource
  • url_prefix – prefix url for specific resource
  • endpoint – resource endpoint. By default it would be table.__name__.
  • fields – allowed resource fields for Serializer.
  • exclude – exclude resource fields for Serializer.
  • decorators – view decorator functions.
  • primary_key – primary key column. By default id will be used
Returns:

Blueprint

This method register view functions using ResourceAPI and provide endpoint, session, model and primary key. It also register endpoint using add_url_rule(). Collection and instances have different HTTP methods and url schemes. Finally this method populate the namedtuple RESOURCE_INFO

Resource API View¶

class stargate.resource_api.ResourceAPI(session, model, primary_key=None, *args, **kw)¶

This class is used to provide view functions against resources. By default on GET method is exposed. It accept options like database session, model class, primary key and any other parameter that parent class MethodView provides.

It applies requires_api_accept(), requires_api_mimetype() catch_processing_exceptions() decorators by default.

Example usage for this class:

from resource_api import ResourceAPI

ResourceAPI.as_view(session, model)

#Specify primary_key id
ResourceAPI.as_view(session, model, primary_key = 'ser_id')

#MethodView args example
ResourceAPI.as_view(session, model, primary_key = 'ser_id', _external=True)
get(pk_id=None, relation=None, related_id=None)¶

Provides HTTP GET Method against a resource. Can be a collection or single instance. For more information about method and options check get method

Parameters:
  • pk_id – resource primary key id.
  • relation – related collection name.
  • related_id – primary key id od related resource
Returns:

Representation

For request query string options check docs get.collection

post()¶

Create resource against data provided in payload.

Returns:Representation instance.
Raise Following exceptions:
  • InvalidPayload if fails to convert payload to JSON.
  • stargate.exception.DatabaseError If session.commit() fails.

For more information on POST method and payload options check post method docs

patch(pk_id)¶

Update resource(s) against data provided in payload. Can create new resources on fly as well

Parameters:pk_id – primary key id of resource to be updated.
Returns:Representation instance.

Raise following exceptions:

  • InvalidPayload if fails to convert payload to JSON.
  • stargate.exception.DatabaseError If session.commit() fails.
  • MissingData if data key is missing either in primary attribute
    of _embedded resource.
  • MissingPrimaryKey if primary key id is missing.
  • UnknownField if field doesnot exists on resource.

For more information on PATCH method and payload options check post method docs

delete(pk_id)¶

Delete resource against id provided in path param.

Parameters:pk_id – primary key id of resource to be updated.
Returns:Representation instance.

Raise following exception if operation fail:

  • stargate.exception.DatabaseError If session.commit() fails.

For more information on DELETE method and payload options check post method docs

Serialization¶

class stargate.serializer.Serializer(model, primary_key, fields=None, exclude=None)¶

Application Default serialization class. Each resource regsiter its own copy of this class during initilization in Manager. Raise exception of type IllegalArgumentError if both fields and exclude key word arguments are not None

Parameters:
  • model – SQLALchemy model.
  • primary_key – Primary key column for model.
  • fields – Resource attributes to be serialized. By default all attributes will be seriaized.
  • exclude – Exclude resource attributes from serialization.

This class can be used globally within stargate package. Example usage of this class: #Return User serialization class

serializer = resource_info(ResourceInfoConst.SERIALIZER, User)
data = serializer(data)
__call__(result_set, fields=None, exclude=None, expand=None, serialize_rel=True)¶

Callable for Serializer class. Can serialize list and single instance of SQLAlchemy resutlset objects.

Example:

serializer = resource_info(ResourceInfoConst.SERIALIZER, User)
#This execute callable.
data = serializer(data)
Parameters:
  • result_set – List or single insance of SQLALchemy resuit set.
  • fields – Resource attributes to be serialized.
  • exclude – Resource attributes to be exluded from serialized.
  • expand – Exclude resource attributes from serialization.
  • serialize_rel – Boolean for serializing related resources.
_serialize_many(columns, result_set, expand=None, serialize_rel=False)¶

Called internally from __call__ if list of object need to be serialized

Parameters:
  • columns – Resource database table columns.
  • result_set – Objects needs to be serilized.
  • expand – List of relations need to be expanded.
  • serialize_rel – Boolean for serializing related resources.
_serialize_one(columns, instance, expand=None, serialize_rel=None)¶

Called internally from __call__ if single object need to be serialized

Parameters:
  • columns – Resource database table columns.
  • instance – Object needs to be serilized.
  • expand – List of relations need to be expanded.
  • serialize_rel – Boolean for serializing related resources.

Deserialization¶

class stargate.deserializer.Deserializer(model, session)¶

Default Deserializer class. Each resource regsiter its own copy of this class during initilization in Manager

Parameters:
  • session – SQLALchemy session object.
  • model – Resource model class.
__call__(document)¶

Callable for Deserializer class. Deserialize JSONObject representation. Raise MissingDataKey id data key is not present in request payload.

Example:

deserializer = resource_info(ResourceInfoConst.DESERIALIZER, User)
#This execute callable.
data = deserializer(data)
Parameters:document – JSON request payload.
_deserialize(instance)¶

Called internally by __call__ method to deseriaize JSONObject representation. Raise DeserializationException if operation fails. Raise UnknownRelation if unknown relation name is provided in _embedded key.Raise UnknownField if unknown field is provided in relation data key or primary resource data key.

Parameters:instance – JSON Representation of object.

Global Helper¶

class stargate.resource_info.ResourceInfo¶

This class provides information about a resource registered with any Manager instance. Data keys include :

  • PRIMARY_KEY
  • COLLECTION_NAME
  • URL
  • SERIALIZER
  • DESERIALIZER

This is a Singleton class that can be accessed any where in the application by just importing it.

Example:

from resource_info import resource_info

#returns primary_key for model class User
resource_info(PRIMARY_KEY, User)

#returns collection_name for model class User
resource_info(COLLECTION_NAME, User)

#returns fully qualified url for model class User
resource_info(URL, User)

#returns Serializer class for model class User
resource_info(SERIALIZER, User)

#returns DeSerializer class for model class User
resource_info(DESERIALIZER, User)

Raises ValueError if unknown key is provided to the resource_info callable, it also raises ValueError if model class is not registered with any Manager instance.
